news_header: Hollywood is facing a crisis as film crews increasingly choose to shoot in cities like Atlanta and Toronto due to cheaper labor and tax incentives. The recent wildfires have worsened the situation, prompting calls for local production support.
news_original_title: Too quiet on set? Hollywood pushes for more LA productions post wildfires
news_text: Many filmmakers, including production designer Mark Worthington, are struggling after losing their homes and jobs. While Hollywood studios have donated to fire relief, there are demands for more commitment to filming in LA. A grassroots campaign is pushing for increased tax incentives to revive local production. The decline of Hollywood is likened to the fall of Detroit, raising concerns about the future of the industry in Los Angeles.
